intro: Horkelia pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, delicate yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with narrow, grass-like leaves. Horkelia pygmaea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
